intro: Trichogonia villosa, commonly known as the hairy trichogonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its delicate structure, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
